intro: Lachenalia bowkeri, commonly known as the Knysna lachenalia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its rosette of narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces striking, bell-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange during the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires full sun exposure. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant.
